column4: hi, im in network manager, and i hit unlock then change some stuff, then when it should reload it says "The configuration could not be saved You are not allowed to modify the system configuration"
what are you trying to change?
if you cant use the gui, open up the config file iteself and change it by hand
put in the password for my wireless
ok gimme one sec, not quite sure where ubuntu stores the wep password
thanks
have a look in /etc/network/interfaces, and see if there is mention of WEP
yes there is thanks =p
fixed that =p, sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart didnt cause me to get connected though.... ideas plz?
firewall, dhcp server, manual config set wrong, router config....
not sure
same as crackhead, try restarting the interface
try "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart"
see if it now works?
networking  restart doesnt try to dhcp discover
do you have "dhcp" as part of your /etc/network/interfaces?

yes -> audo lo 
 iface lo inet loopback 
 iface wlan0 inet dhcp 
 wireless-key STUFF 
 wireless essid linux
put "auto" infront of the interface? is audo a typo in here or in the config?
ah thx might be problem :) should i add audo wlan0 \n before the iface wlan0 inet.... one?>
yes, but its "auto", not audo
crackhead100_, I have to go, dentist appointment ;(. pm me ifyou still havnt fixed it, il be back later
omg THANKS SO MUCH worked
